meanings.definition: The quality of being sacred or inviolable.
meanings.sent1: The sacrosanctity of the ancient temple was respected by all.
meanings.sent2: The family heirloom held a special sacrosanctity in their hearts.
meanings.sent3: The children played around the garden, unaware of the sacrosanctity of the delicate flowers.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, his promises had the sacrosanctity of a solemn oath.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to protect the sacrosanctity of the royal treasure at all costs.

meanings.definition: The state of being regarded as too important or valuable to be interfered with.
meanings.sent1: The sacrosanctity of her personal space was violated by the intrusive neighbor.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's office was treated with the sacrosanctity befitting a king's chamber.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mischievous nature, he understood the sacrosanctity of his mother's favorite vase.
meanings.sent4: The artist's studio held a sacrosanctity that inspired awe in all who entered.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript was handled with the sacrosanctity of a fragile treasure.
